definition: lit. to ascend to heaven/to die
to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
variant of 升[sheng1]
variant of 升[sheng1]/to ascend/to rise in rank
day/sky/heaven

lit. poultry and dogs rise to Heaven (idiom)/fig. to ride on sb else's success/Once one man gets a government position, all his cronies get in too/Once sb has cracked the problem, every Tom, Dick and Harry can do it

lit. when a man achieves the Dao, his poultry and dogs rise to Heaven (idiom)/fig. to ride on sb else's success/Once one man gets a government position, all his cronies get in too/Once sb has cracked the problem, every Tom, Dick and Harry can do it
pinyin: yi1 ren2 de2 dao4 , ji1 quan3 sheng1 tian1

definition: Ascension Day (Christian festival forty days after Easter)
Assumption of the Virgin Mary (Christian festival on 15th August)

sentences.english: Jesus goes back to Heaven this event is called The Ascension.
sentences.chinese: 最后的宗教节日在耶稣升天节达到高潮。

sentences.english: Employment will shrink in a financial spiral of economic austerity.
sentences.chinese: 在经济紧缩，金融得道升天的情况下，就业将很严峻。

sentences.english: It is said, under the clothing this medicine, can instantly ascend to heaven becomes an immortal.
sentences.chinese: 据说，服下此药，能即刻升天成仙。

sentences.english: The apostles returned from the Mount of Olives to Jerusalem.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣升天后，宗徒们从橄榄山回到耶路撒冷。

sentences.english: The final fiesta climaxed on Ascension Day.
sentences.chinese: 最后的宗教节日在耶稣升天节达到高潮。

sentences.english: Elijah is going to heaven, and Elisha must stay behind.
sentences.chinese: 以利亚要升天了，而以利沙则必须留下。

sentences.english: Humans who eat it will reach consummation and become deities.
sentences.chinese: 吃到它的人，能白日升天，成为上仙。

sentences.english: The church starts and does not have the Christmas day, ascends to heaven in Jesus the latter more than hundred year talent to have approximately.
sentences.chinese: 教会开始并无圣诞节，约在耶稣升天后百余年内才有。

sentences.english: This is the spirit promised by Jesus just before his ascension.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣在升天之前也应许将赐下圣灵。

sentences.english: Fable Jesus is nailed tight on the cross, after dying, third day of reactivating ascends to heaven.
sentences.chinese: 传说耶稣被钉死在十字架上，死后第三天复活升天。

sentences.english: If she could be translated to Heaven tomorrow, she might be expected to ascend without any rapture.
sentences.chinese: 哪怕明天就能升天成仙，料想她也不会欣喜若狂。

sentences.english: When he had finished talking with Abraham, God ascended and left him.
sentences.chinese: 说完这话以后，上帝离开了亚伯拉罕升天而去。

sentences.english: They mourn the spirit of a tree when it dies.
sentences.chinese: 他们为一颗树的灵魂升天表示哀悼。

sentences.english: According to some Buddhists, those who have seen the buddha's Halo will go to heaven and become immortal.
sentences.chinese: 信佛的人说，看道这种景色的人就可以升天成佛。

sentences.english: Close friends of the Mubarak government also prosper.
sentences.chinese: 穆巴拉克政府的朋友们也都鸡犬升天了。

sentences.english: The dodo should just have a sign on him that says, “Please kill me.”
sentences.chinese: 渡渡鸟应身系一签，其云“让我彻底升天吧”。

definition: to become immortal
(of a supernatural or divine being) to appear/to make itself manifest
to become immortal/big promotion/die
lit. to descend to earth (of an immortal)/to be born
to levitate heavenwards (a Daoist success)/to take off/to soar (of prices)
to levitate heavenwards (a Daoist success)/to take off/to soar (of prices)
to be reincarnated
reincarnation or transmigration (Buddhism)
to descend to the world (of immortals)
virtuous achievements come to their successful conclusion (idiom)
to achieve the Dao/to become an immortal
Daoist immortal/supernatural entity/(in modern fiction) fairy, elf, leprechaun etc/fig. lighthearted person
to be reborn/to recover/to come back to life/to regenerate
to die
to die/euphemism, lit. to return West or to the Western Paradise
paradise (mainly Buddhist)/Elysium/(Budd.) Sukhavati
Jesus (耶稣 is more usual)
